result.execSummary:
The defendant William J. Kirschbaum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

timeConds.notes:
Jail sentence shall be suspended after 1st 60 days pending satisfactory participation in the Dodge County Treatment program currently enrolled
Consecutive to: Sentence shall commence on or before Court ordered start date; with work release and transfer privileges

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence(s) currently imposed

14CF168, 14CF328, 14CF376 & 15CF65 - Defendant William J. Kirschbaum in court with attorney Catherine Jane Terry.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions def and reviews chgs and pens.  14CF168 - guilty plea entered in count 1;  14CF376 - guilty plea entered in count 1; 15CF65 - guilty plea entered in count 1.  Court accepts pleas and finds def guilty;  all remaining counts are DRI.  State heard on sentencing recomendations.  Atty Terry heard.  Def. heard.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

w/held sentence - 5 yrs probation
8 mos DCJ - Suspended after 1st 60 days pending satisfactory participation in the Dodge County Treatment program currently enrolled in comm on or before 5/11/15 - in Case 14CF168
1 day credit in 14CF168 and 2 days credit in 14CF376
court costs
AODA
maintain absolute sobriety
no use or possession of illegal controlled substance w/o a valid prescription
no use or possession of drug paraphernalia
no operation of mv w/o valid dl
do not enter any establishment whose primary business involves the sale of alcohol
provide DNA sample
character letter
certificate of credit

Called cases 14CF168 and 14CF328.  Defendant William J. Kirschbaum in court with attorney Catherine Jane Terry.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This will be plea/sent. hearing. Atty Thompson heard regarding a new felony charge for Def.  Atty Terry heard, after further discussion with her client, she requests to have all three cases heard together at later date.  Court proceeded with ARGN for case no. 14CF328.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; stc set; bail con't. Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant William J. Kirschbaum in court, in custody with attorney Greg E Vollan (eligible).  Intern Holdolt w/ Robert G Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
